Dear KELLY RYBICKI:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
4/5/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan
is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action
plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all of
the following information prior to employment or at the
time specified in this rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee’s
performance within 30 days of the completion of the
probationary period or within 180 days, whichever is
2

less, and a written evaluation of the employee’s
performance annually thereafter.
One of five new hire employee files reviewed did not have the written evaluation
completed as required. The written evaluation was completed 14-days outside of
the 180-day range.
CCI Rule 400.4147 Dental care
(2) A dental examination within 12 months prior to
admission shall be documented or there shall be an
examination not later than 90 calendar days following
admission.
One of three active youth files reviewed did not have documentation of the
required dental examination within 90-days.
CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and
date an initial treatment plan for each resident within 30
calendar days of admission.
One of three active youth files reviewed did not have the initial treatment plan
completed within the required 30-day time frame. Although the report period was
documented as 29 days, the report was not completed for another 23-days.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and
date an updated treatment plan for each resident at
least once every 90-calendar days following the initial
treatment plan.
Two of three active youth files reviewed did not have the updated treatment plan
completed within the required 90-day period. The first UTP (Updated Treatment
Plan) was completed 9-days outside the 90-day period. The second UTP had a
report period of 89 days but was not completed until 16-days later.
3

CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(a) The date of and reason for discharge, and the
new location of the child.
Two of two closed youth files reviewed did not have the discharge summary
completed within 14-days of discharge. One discharge summary was completed
82-days after discharge and the second was completed 78-days after discharge.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency is documenting what the case manager and therapist will do to assist
the youth in accomplishing their goals but add what the direct care staff will do to
assist the youth in accomplishing their treatment goals.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Develop an electronic recording keeping system.
• Develop different dates for actions steps so they youth have a stair-step of action
steps building upon each other.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review with the exception of the CAP for the Renewal Inspection last
year. The facility developed a CAP for the Renewal that was approved on
5/5/2022. This CAP involved action steps to resolve the six violations found. The
facility was successful in implementing their action steps in the CAP as evidenced
by no repeat violations.
Financial Overview
The financial audit performed by an independent CPA was provided and reviewed.
The facility is in good financial condition.
4

PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
This assessment addresses events that have taken place at the facility since the
last licensing inspection. It outlines the efforts to balance all of the requirements of
governing bodies (ORR, DCWL, and policies/ procedures of Bethany). The issues
of hiring appropriate staff is also outlined along with the changes made such as a
raise in salaries and involvement in a hiring market. Another issue addressed is
appropriate referrals from ORR. Three youth have presented behavioral issues that
exceed what the program is designed to help. The facility is changing part of the
referral assessments in order to help identify youth who do not fit the program so
they can avoid similar issues. The assessment addressed their efforts to complete
the CAP from their last inspection and they have been successful in almost all
aspects. There were no repeat violations during this inspection.
Staff and Youth Interviews
All staff interviewed presented with a belief that the facility is providing best
practices when dealing with the youth in the program. They identified the training
provided by the facility and that it helps with their interactions.
All of the youth interviewed reported feeling safe and having staff provide constant
supervision.
Description of Agency Walk Through
It is a single-story facility of modern design and very well maintained. The facility is
clean, and all requirements were met. The fire extinguishers were up to date and all
cleaning supplies were locked. The medication is double locked. All toilets, sinks,
and showers had both hot and cold running water, and all had appropriate
drainage.
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
